headline: Electric cars, an escaped gorilla and fracking  green news roundup
text: Environment news  Electric vehicles could go first at traffic lights under UK clean air zone plans Majority of potential UK fracking sites are rich in important wildlife London zoo denies gorilla escaped by smashing window Electric cars set to pass 2m landmark globally by end of 2016 British public support for fracking sinks to lowest ever level UK must focus on carbon removal to meet Paris goals, climate advisers urge Moratorium on logging Tasmanias old growth forests could be reversed Germany takes steps to roll back renewable energy revolution UK loses top 10 spot in global energy ranking for the first time An energy first as UK successfully transmits data via national electricity grid Hurricane Sandy-level flooding is rising so sharply that it could become normal Record low number of British butterflies a shock and a mystery  Features and comment  Can an upcycling expert transform my junk? Clintons little-known crusade to save Africas elephants Walking into the unknown: rural England weighs up the reality of Brexit Science Museum condemned for oil company sponsorship  Multimedia  The EUs effect on Blackpools beaches  before and after pictures The week in wildlife  in pictures Xavi Bous photographs reveal flight paths of birds  in pictures A celebration of botanical art throughout history  in pictures  And finally...  Watch the moment a great white smashed through a shark cage during a diving trip  video
